original_title: Sri Lanka shares close up, turnover remains low
original_body_lines: ECONOMYNEXT – The Colombo Stock Exchange closed up on Wednesday, CSE data showed.
The All Share Price Index was up 0.58 percent, or 61.06 points, at 10,513.
The S&P SL20 index was up 0.24 percent, or 7.09 points, at 2,977.
Turnover was at 735 million. The capital goods sector contributed 119 million, transportation sector 116 million and banks 117 million of this.
Top positive contributors to the ASPI were DFCC Bank Plc (up at 78.50), National Development Bank Plc (up at 66.80) and Sampath Bank Plc (up at 67.60). (Colombo/Nov29/2023).
